canonical_structure.name: UBX-CFG-TMODE3
canonical_structure.description: Time mode settings 3. Configures the receiver to be in Time Mode (Survey-in or Fixed). Position can be ECEF or LLA.

fields.name: ecefXOrLat
fields.description: WGS84 ECEF X coordinate (cm) or Latitude (1e-7 deg), depending on flags.lla

fields.name: ecefYOrLon
fields.description: WGS84 ECEF Y coordinate (cm) or Longitude (1e-7 deg), depending on flags.lla

fields.name: ecefZOrAlt
fields.description: WGS84 ECEF Z coordinate (cm) or Altitude (cm), depending on flags.lla. Note: Altitude is always linear units (cm), not degrees.

fields.name: ecefXOrLatHP
fields.description: High-precision component. Range -99 to +99. Units: 0.1 mm (if ECEF X) or 1e-9 deg (if Lat).

fields.name: ecefYOrLonHP
fields.description: High-precision component. Range -99 to +99. Units: 0.1 mm (if ECEF Y) or 1e-9 deg (if Lon).

fields.name: ecefZOrAltHP
fields.description: High-precision component. Range -99 to +99. Units: 0.1 mm (for both ECEF Z and Altitude).

issues: Flags bitfield definition missing 'lla' bit (bit 8), though coordinate descriptions imply it.
Incomplete payload. Only extracted first 3 fields (4 bytes), actual length is 40.
Description error in 'ecefZOrAlt' and 'ecefZOrAltHP': incorrectly states Altitude units as 'degrees'. Altitude is linear (cm/0.1mm).

adjudication.reasoning: The message structure is stable across generations (M8 to F9). It consists of a fixed 40-byte payload. Extraction 2 is clearly truncated. Extractions 3, 4, and 5 provide the most complete field definitions, particularly regarding the 'flags' bitfield which controls whether coordinates are ECEF or LLA. Extraction 1 omits the LLA bit definition but is structurally sound. Extraction 6 contains a textual error in the description of Altitude units (degrees instead of cm), likely a documentation or extraction artifact, but the byte structure matches the canonical definition.
